alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 9:59PM CDT until June 02 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following river in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River at Taberville. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Saturday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.3 feet on 08/12/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 1100 PM CDT.
